dbdao.core

Class CustomerDBDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbdao.core.CustomerDBDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CustomerDAO

    public class CustomerDBDAO
extends java.lang.Object
implements CustomerDAO
    This class consists of the programming logic for customer objects. It is used only for translation from java objects to SQL and back. For business logic, see CustomerFacade class.

      void createCustomer(Customer customer)
      This method is used to create a new customer records in the customer table.
      java.util.Collection<Customer> getAllCustomers()
      This methods will allow to a caller to view/or change all the customers records in the database;

      boolean login(java.lang.String custName, java.lang.String password)

      Use this method to delete all the customer information from the database.
      long searchForID(java.lang.String custName)
      This method will help to identify the current customer when he is using a facade instance.
      void updateCustomer(Customer customer)
      This method updates customer records in the database.
      void updateCustomerExceptName(Customer customer)
      This method is a version of updateCustomer() method, except that caller can't change customer's name.

      • removeCustomer

        public void removeCustomer(Customer customer)
        Use this method to delete all the customer information from the database. NOTE: customer's purchase history is still available in the database.
        Specified by:
        removeCustomer in interface CustomerDAO

      • updateCustomer

        public void updateCustomer(Customer customer)
        This method updates customer records in the database. Please note that customer's purchase history is updated with other method in the CustomerFacade"
        Specified by:
        updateCustomer in interface CustomerDAO

      • updateCustomerExceptName

        public void updateCustomerExceptName(Customer customer)
